title: Ticket #7182: name conflict with collectd causes a crash
description:
Our users at IN2P3 found a problem using the python bindings with collectd. The details are here: https://github.com/collectd/collectd/issues/3240

It involves what I can only describe as a bug in the Linux linker, -- when collectd loads our python bindings module, a function in collectd gets linked into the bowels of condor_utils and we crash trying to load the condor configuration.

Even though this is clearly not our bug. I'm proposing that we rename the offending function and change it to c++ linkage to make the problem go away. The current name isn't the best anyway.
remarks:
2019-Aug-06 16:19:22 by tlmiller:
Code Review

I don't like setting this precedent, but the patch looks good and the new names are an improvement.

As noted, needs a version history item.
